verses.roman:
punar gadāṁ svām ādāya
bhrāmayantam abhīkṣṇaśaḥ
abhyadhāvad dhariḥ kruddhaḥ
saṁrambhād daṣṭa-dacchadam

synonyms: punaḥ—again; gadām—mace; svām—his; ādāya—having taken; bhrāmayantam—brandishing; abhīkṣṇaśaḥ—repeatedly; abhyadhāvat—rushed to meet; hariḥ—the Personality of Godhead; kruddhaḥ—angry; saṁrambhāt—in rage; daṣṭa—bitten; dacchadam—his lip.
translation: The Personality of Godhead now exhibited His anger and rushed to meet the demon, who bit his lip in rage, took up his mace again and began to repeatedly brandish it about.
